stringParam.name: primaryKey
stringParam.help: primary key

stringParam.name: locus_tag
stringParam.help: Gene IDs (locus tags) are quite different for each species. We use the gene IDs provided by the sequence generator. (Examples: PF11_0344, AAB36701.1, NP_701203.1).

stringParam.name: min_mutual_information_score
stringParam.help: Enter the minimum mutual information score to report similarities. The score range is from 0.472 to 1.67

stringParam.name: min_num_query_matches
stringParam.help: Enter the minimum number of queries you want to match to your genes. If you input 5 genes ids for your query and enter 5 minimum number of queries then the only genes returned would be ones that all 5 queries match

stringParam.name: ec_number_pattern
stringParam.help: Enzyme Commission numbers describe enzymes hierarchically by the class of rections they catalize.

stringParam.name: num_exons_gte
stringParam.help: Which genes in Plasmodium are annotated as containing introns? One easy way to do this search is to look for genes with more than one annotated exon. Enter a minimum of exons you would like to search for as an integer, e.g. '3'.

stringParam.name: num_exons_lte
stringParam.help: Enter a maximum number of exons you would like to search for as an integer, e.g. '3'.

stringParam.name: bp_overlap_gte
stringParam.help: Overlap of expressed sequence tag (EST) alignments with annotated genes is a useful approach to verify gene predictions. In general, the specificity of this evidence is proportional to the overlap length.

flatVocabParam.name: cowmanSample
flatVocabParam.help: Select ...

flatVocabParam.name: diffMeanExpr_reference
flatVocabParam.help: Select ...

flatVocabParam.name: diffMeanExpr_comparitor
flatVocabParam.help: Select ...

flatVocabParam.name: regulated_dir
flatVocabParam.help: Select ...

stringParam.name: min_tm
stringParam.help: Proteins may have none, one or more transmembrane domains. Please enter a minimum number of predicted transmembrane domains to start your search.

stringParam.name: min_sigp_sum_score
stringParam.help: SignalP provides four scores and a conclusion for each such that the conclusion is 1 if the score meets a certain criteria and 0 otherwise. The SignalP summary conclusion is the sum of the four conclusions generated by SignalP, thus four is the highest score possible. We consider a summary conclusion score of three to be significant

stringParam.name: max_tm
stringParam.help: Proteins may have none, one or more transmembrane domains. Please enter a maximum number of predicted transmembrane domains to start your search.

stringParam.name: extDbName
stringParam.help: The name of an external database as found in GUS

stringParam.name: extDbRlsVer
stringParam.help: The version of an external database release as found in GUS

stringParam.name: sequence
stringParam.help: Sequence IDs for P. falciparum chromosomes are 'MAL1' through 'MAL14.' Sequence IDs for P. yoelii contigs begin with 'MALPY'. Sequence IDs for P. vivax contigs begin with 'ctg_'. Wild cards are permitted in this search, i.e. use MALPY* to ask for all P. vivax sequences.

flatVocabParam.name: organism
flatVocabParam.help: Select one or more organisms.

flatVocabParam.name: organism_with_sequences
flatVocabParam.help: Select one or more organisms.

flatVocabParam.name: organism_with_ests
flatVocabParam.help: Select one or more organisms.

flatVocabParam.name: pf_organism
flatVocabParam.help: Select an organism.

flatVocabParam.name: species_name
flatVocabParam.help: Select one or more organisms.

flatVocabParam.name: libraryId
flatVocabParam.help: Select a clone library.

flatVocabParam.name: best_alignment_only
flatVocabParam.help: Select yes to return only those EST alignments that are the best alignment for the EST. Many of the ESTs align at multiple positions in the genome. Selecting yes will consider only those alignments that are the best for each EST

flatVocabParam.name: high_confidence_only
flatVocabParam.help: Select yes to return only those EST alignments that are consistent. We define define consistent as having >= 95% identity (the majority have >= 99%) and aligning the EST sequence in a manner that is consistent with a gene model. Ie, there can be gaps (representing introns) in the target genomic sequence but not in the EST query.

flatVocabParam.name: whole_words
flatVocabParam.help: Select whether to reject text matches that start or end in the middle of a word

flatVocabParam.name: geneType
flatVocabParam.help: Select a gene type.

flatVocabParam.name: includePseudogenes
flatVocabParam.help: Choose whether to include pseudogenes in your query results.

stringParam.name: protein_id
stringParam.help: Only used in a nested record

stringParam.name: plasmodb_dataset
stringParam.help: PlasmoDB dataset

historyParam.name: historyId
historyParam.help: The number in the left column of My Query History

stringParam.name: min_percent_identity
stringParam.help: You can specify a minimum percent identity of the alignment between the EST and genomic DNA. We only store alignments with >= 90% identity

stringParam.name: min_percent_est_aligned
stringParam.help: Enter the minimum percentage of bases in the EST sequence that are aligned to genomic DNA in this alignment.

stringParam.name: go_term
stringParam.help: Enter a GO ID (e.g. \"GO:0003824\") or GO Term (e.g. \"catalytic activity\"). Asterisks can be used as wildcard characters in a GO Term (e.g. \"*kinase*\"

stringParam.name: pfam_term
stringParam.help: Enter a Pfam accession number (e.g. \"PF00478\") or definition (\"NPR nonapeptide repeat\") . Asterisks can be used as wildcard characters in a Pfam definition (e.g. \"Ribosomal*\"

flatVocabParam.name: bait_or_prey
flatVocabParam.prompt: Specified protein is bait or prey
flatVocabParam.help: Optionally specifiy whether given protein is bait or prey

stringParam.name: min_observed
stringParam.prompt: Restrict by the minimum number of times this interaction was found
stringParam.help: Restrict by the minimum number of times this interaction was found

stringParam.name: min_searches
stringParam.prompt: Restrict by the minimum number of searches that found this interaction
stringParam.help: Restrict by the minimum number of searches that found this interaction

stringParam.name: max_results
stringParam.help: Upper limit on the number of results returned by the query

flatVocabParam.name: BlastQueryType
flatVocabParam.help: The type of the query sequence (eg. DNA, protein)

flatVocabParam.name: BlastDatabaseType
flatVocabParam.help: The type of the target database (eg CDS, translated CDS, Protein)

flatVocabParam.name: BlastDatabaseOrganism
flatVocabParam.help: Organism(s) from which the sequences in the BLAST database originated

stringParam.name: BlastQuerySequence
stringParam.help: BLAST Input Sequence

flatVocabParam.name: -filter
flatVocabParam.help: Set the low complexity filter. WUBLAST's default behavior is not to use this filter. NCBIBLAST's is to use it. When filter is set to 'yes' WUBLAST uses seg; NCBIBLAST uses dust for blastn, seg otherwise.

stringParam.name: -e
stringParam.help: Expected number of hits by chance

stringParam.name: -v
stringParam.help: Number of one-line descriptions to show

stringParam.name: -b
stringParam.help: Number of alignments to show

stringParam.name: dn_ds_ratio_upper
stringParam.help: Upper Bound on the ratio of non-synonymous to synonymous coding snps

stringParam.name: dn_ds_ratio_lower
stringParam.help: Lower Bound on the ratio of non-synonymous to synonymous coding snps

stringParam.name: min_num_coding_snps
stringParam.help: Lower Bound on the number of coding snps

stringParam.name: occurrences_upper
stringParam.prompt: Number of SNPs of above class <=
stringParam.help: Upper Bound on the number of SNPs of the selected class

stringParam.name: occurrences_lower
stringParam.prompt: Number of SNPs of above class >=
stringParam.help: Lower Bound on the number of SNPs of the selected class

stringParam.name: major_allele_max
stringParam.help: Upper Bound on the number of strains that have the major allele

stringParam.name: major_allele_min
stringParam.help: Lower Bound on the number strains that have the major allele

stringParam.name: minor_allele_max
stringParam.help: Upper Bound on the number of strains that have the minor allele

stringParam.name: minor_allele_min
stringParam.help: Lower Bound on the number of strains that have the minor allele

stringParam.name: snp_density
stringParam.help: Find genes containing a density of coding snps > this parameter. Density is expressed in number of snps / KB of coding sequence

flatVocabParam.name: chromosome_single
flatVocabParam.help: Pick a P. falciparum chromosome

flatVocabParam.name: snp_strain_a
flatVocabParam.help: Choose a reference from the list of strains. Strains below the ---------- were sequenced at low or specific coverage

flatVocabParam.name: snp_strain_b
flatVocabParam.help: Choose a comparator from the list to compare to your reference. Strains below the ---------- were sequenced at low or specific coverage

flatVocabParam.name: snp_strain_m
flatVocabParam.help: Choose a comparator(s) from the list to compare to your reference. Strains below the ---------- were sequenced at low or specific coverage

flatVocabParam.name: include_reichenowi
flatVocabParam.help: Click yes to include P. reichenowi snps in this query. P.r snps were generated by alignment of P. reichenowi sequence with the P falciparum 3D7 reference sequence. Note, if you want to only query reichenowi, you must click 'None' in the P. falciparum strains select list.

flatVocabParam.name: include_only_queries
flatVocabParam.help: Click yes to to restrict the results returned to only those genes which have been input as query ids. This allows you to determine the relatedness of your query set

flatVocabParam.name: snp_stat
flatVocabParam.help: Choose the class of SNP you want to query on ... choose minumum and maximum numbers below

flatVocabParam.name: snp_order
flatVocabParam.help: Results will be sorted on this column in descending order

flatVocabParam.name: sort_order
flatVocabParam.help: Results will be sorted ascending or descending order

flatVocabParam.name: maxPlusMinusHours
flatVocabParam.prompt: Maximal expression time plus or minus

flatVocabParam.name: minPlusMinusHours
flatVocabParam.prompt: Minimum expression time plus or minus

stringParam.name: genomicSequence
stringParam.help: ID of genomic sequence to search for genes (e.g. ctg_7202)

stringParam.name: start_location
stringParam.help: Lower bound on nucleotide range to search for gene

stringParam.name: end_location
stringParam.help: Upper bound on nucleotide range to search for gene. Use a number larger than the sequence length to search to the end of the sequence.

stringParam.name: min_expression_percentile
stringParam.help: Lower bound on expression percentile.

stringParam.name: max_expression_percentile
stringParam.help: Upper bound on expression percentile.

stringParam.name: r_min_expression_percentile
stringParam.help: Lower bound on expression percentile.

stringParam.name: r_max_expression_percentile
stringParam.help: Upper bound on expression percentile.

stringParam.name: yt_min_expression_percentile
stringParam.help: Lower bound on expression percentile.

stringParam.name: yt_max_expression_percentile
stringParam.help: Upper bound on expression percentile.

stringParam.name: ys_min_expression_percentile
stringParam.help: Lower bound on expression percentile.

stringParam.name: ys_max_expression_percentile
stringParam.help: Upper bound on expression percentile.

stringParam.name: ms_min_expression_percentile
stringParam.help: Lower bound on expression percentile.

stringParam.name: ms_max_expression_percentile
stringParam.help: Upper bound on expression percentile.

stringParam.name: ortholog_pattern
stringParam.help: This will be generated by clicking the species tree nodes.

flatVocabParam.name: mr4_reagent_type
flatVocabParam.help: Choose a reagent type

flatVocabParam.name: Dataset
flatVocabParam.help: Choose one or more organisms to search with the given motif

stringParam.name: Expression
stringParam.help: Enter a Perl regular expression describing the desired motif. Example: 'CC6+RK' searches for two consecutive cysteine residues followed by a stretch of hydrophobic amino acids followed by the aminoacids arginine and lysine.

stringParam.name: min_isoelectric_point
stringParam.help: Lower bound for the protein isoelectric point

stringParam.name: max_isoelectric_point
stringParam.help: Upper bound for the protein isoelectric point

stringParam.name: min_molecular_weight
stringParam.help: Lower bound for the protein molecular weight

stringParam.name: max_molecular_weight
stringParam.help: Upper bound for the protein molecular weight

stringParam.name: profile_pattern
stringParam.help: Example: '%hsa:N%pfa:Y%'

stringParam.name: included_species
stringParam.help: List of included species (for documentation only)

stringParam.name: excluded_species
stringParam.help: List of excluded species (for documentation only)

stringParam.name: min_exportpred_score
stringParam.help: mininum requirement of score by ExportPred algorithm

stringParam.name: min_interaction
stringParam.help: Set a minimum for the likelihood of interaction

flatVocabParam.name: mass_spec_stage
flatVocabParam.help: Select a lifecycle stage from the list provided.

stringParam.name: min_seq_coverage
stringParam.help: Use this parameter to set a minimum amount of (amino acid) sequence coverage for the mass spec-predicted peptides. For example, setting this parameter to 10 will return only those genes whose proteins are at least 10% covered by mass spec.-predicted peptides. In the current dataset the average percent coverage is about 9%, and the maximum is about 90%. Note that even if this parameter is set to 0%, only genes with at least some mass spec. predictions for the specified stage will be returned. In other words, it never returns proteins with 0% coverage, only those with strictly > 0%.

stringParam.name: min_span_count
stringParam.help: Use this parameter to set a minimum for the number of nonoverlapping regions (spans) that must be found in the mass spec. data for a gene (and the specified lifecycle stage). Only genes with at least this many spans are returned

stringParam.name: min_spectrum_count
stringParam.help: Use this parameter to set a minimum for the number of mass spectra found that must match a gene in order for it to be returned by the query. Roughly speaking this parameter provides a measure of the abundance of the protein product in question, at least within a particular experiment.

stringParam.name: genbank_accession
stringParam.help: Enter a GenBank Accession number

stringParam.name: distanceFromTelomere
stringParam.help: Enter an upper bound on the distance.

stringParam.name: percentLowComplexity
stringParam.prompt: Percent of Low Complexity in Protein
stringParam.help: Enter an lower bound on the percent of low complexity.

stringParam.name: max_centromere_distance
stringParam.help: Enter an upper bound on the distance

stringParam.name: start_point
stringParam.help: Select the distance (in nucleotides) to the start

flatVocabParam.name: start_from
flatVocabParam.help: Select whether to measure the start point from the beginning or end of the sequence

stringParam.name: end_point
stringParam.help: Select the distance (in nucleotides) for the end location. Note that 0 equals the end so you can get genes right up to the end of the sequence

flatVocabParam.name: end_from
flatVocabParam.help: Select whether to measure the end point from the beginning or end of the sequence

stringParam.name: pvalue_cutoff
stringParam.prompt: BLAST P-value less than 10 to the
stringParam.help: Only consider BLAST similarities with a P-value less than ten to the given power.

flatVocabParam.name: clades
flatVocabParam.help: Select one or more clades.

stringParam.name: accession
stringParam.help: Enter a GenBank, RefSeq, or SwissProt accession number

stringParam.name: min_coil
stringParam.help: Choose a lower bound on the coil percentage. Only genes coding for proteins whose secondary structure contains at least this percentage of coil will be returned.

stringParam.name: max_coil
stringParam.help: Choose a upper bound on the coil percentage. Only genes coding for proteins whose secondary structure contains no more than this percentage of coil will be returned.

stringParam.name: min_strand
stringParam.help: Choose a lower bound on the strand percentage. Only genes coding for proteins whose secondary structure contains at least this percentage of strand will be returned.

stringParam.name: max_strand
stringParam.help: Choose a upper bound on the strand percentage. Only genes coding for proteins whose secondary structure contains no more than this percentage of strand will be returned.

stringParam.name: min_helix
stringParam.help: Choose a lower bound on the helix percentage. Only genes coding for proteins whose secondary structure contains at least this percentage of helix will be returned.

stringParam.name: max_helix
stringParam.help: Choose a upper bound on the helix percentage. Only genes coding for proteins whose secondary structure contains no more than this percentage of helix will be returned.

stringParam.name: ProfileGeneId
stringParam.help: The Gene Id

flatVocabParam.name: ProfileDistanceMethod
flatVocabParam.help: The method used to calculate the similarity distance

stringParam.name: ProfileNumToReturn
stringParam.help: The number of genes in the result

flatVocabParam.name: ProfileSearchGoal
flatVocabParam.help: The searching goal of the profile similarity query

flatVocabParam.name: ProfileProfileSet
flatVocabParam.help: Choose the strain of the profile to search against

flatVocabParam.name: ProfileTimeShift
flatVocabParam.help: Whether to allow time shifting or not

flatVocabParam.name: ProfileScaleData
flatVocabParam.help: Whether to scale result data into [0..1] or not

flatVocabParam.name: ProfileMinShift
flatVocabParam.help: The minimum allowed time shift

flatVocabParam.name: ProfileMaxShift
flatVocabParam.help: The maximum allowed time shift

stringParam.name: text_expression
stringParam.help: Enter a regular expression describing the text term(s) to search for. Example: membrane

flatVocabParam.name: case_independent
flatVocabParam.help: Use this parameter to control whether to include text that matches except for capitalization (e.g. treat 'DNA', 'Dna', and 'dna' as all equal).

flatVocabParam.name: datasets
flatVocabParam.help: Choose which text fields to search.

stringParam.name: max_pvalue
stringParam.prompt: Max p-value exponent (BLAST Hits v. NRDB)
stringParam.help: Only applicable to the 'Similar proteins' field. Use this to filter away BLAST hits that are below a threshold of significance, so you only search the descriptions of significantly similar proteins.

stringParam.name: e_value
stringParam.help: Enter the maximum E value allowed to report domain matches.

flatVocabParam.name: domain_database
flatVocabParam.help: Choose one of the constituent databases of InterPro.

stringParam.name: domain_accession
stringParam.help: Start typing and then choose a domain from the list of domains that come up. As you type the list gets narrowed to match only those entries that match what you have typed.

flatVocabParam.name: day_and_strain
flatVocabParam.help: Choose one or more strain/day combination

datasetParam.name: ds_gene_ids
datasetParam.help: input a comma delimited set of gene ids, or upload a file
